segment.source: Learn about UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps.
segment.target: Learn about UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps.

segment.source: UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps
segment.target: UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps

segment.source: UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps
segment.target: UI and user experience guidelines for ads in apps

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: General UI resources for Windows apps
segment.target: General UI resources for Windows apps

segment.source: You can find information about how to design the look and feel for apps at Design & UI.
segment.target: You can find information about how to design the look and feel for apps at Design & UI.

segment.source: AdControl best practices
segment.target: AdControl best practices

segment.source: AdControl best practices: DO
segment.target: AdControl best practices: DO

segment.source: AdControl best practices: DON'T
segment.target: AdControl best practices: DON'T

segment.source: AdControl best practices: DO
segment.target: AdControl best practices: DO

segment.source: Design advertising into your experience.
segment.target: Design advertising into your experience.

segment.source: Give your designers a sample ad to plan how the advertising is going to look.
segment.target: Give your designers a sample ad to plan how the advertising is going to look.

segment.source: Two examples of well-planned ads in apps are the ads-as-content layout and the split layout.
segment.target: Two examples of well-planned ads in apps are the ads-as-content layout and the split layout.

segment.source: To see how different ad sizes will look and function within your app, you can utilize our test mode ad units for Windows Phone, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.
segment.target: To see how different ad sizes will look and function within your app, you can utilize our test mode ad units for Windows Phone, Windows 8.1, and Windows 10.

segment.source: When you’re done with the test mode ad units, remember to update your app with real ad unit IDs before submitting the app for certification.
segment.target: When you’re done with the test mode ad units, remember to update your app with real ad unit IDs before submitting the app for certification.

segment.source: Plan for times when no ads are available.
segment.target: Plan for times when no ads are available.

segment.source: There may be times when ads aren't being sent to your app.
segment.target: There may be times when ads aren't being sent to your app.

segment.source: Lay out your pages in such a way that they look great whether they showcase an ad or not.
segment.target: Lay out your pages in such a way that they look great whether they showcase an ad or not.

segment.source: For more information, see Error handling.
segment.target: For more information, see Error handling.

segment.source: AdControl Best Practices: DON'T
segment.target: AdControl Best Practices: DON'T

segment.source: Bolt advertising into open real estate.
segment.target: Bolt advertising into open real estate.

segment.source: Ad space shouldn't be placed into the first open piece of real estate you can find.
segment.target: Ad space shouldn't be placed into the first open piece of real estate you can find.

segment.source: Instead, it should be incorporated into your app's overall design.
segment.target: Instead, it should be incorporated into your app's overall design.

segment.source: Over-advertise and saturate your app.
segment.target: Over-advertise and saturate your app.

segment.source: Too many ads in your app detract from its appearance and usability.
segment.target: Too many ads in your app detract from its appearance and usability.

segment.source: You want to make money with advertising, but not at the expense of the app itself.
segment.target: You want to make money with advertising, but not at the expense of the app itself.

segment.source: Distract user from their core tasks.
segment.target: Distract user from their core tasks.

segment.source: The primary focus should always be on the app.
segment.target: The primary focus should always be on the app.

segment.source: The ad space should be incorporated so it remains a secondary focus.
segment.target: The ad space should be incorporated so it remains a secondary focus.

segment.source: Interstitial best practices
segment.target: Interstitial best practices

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: DO
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: DO

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: AVOID
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: AVOID

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: NEVER (Policy Enforced)
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: NEVER (Policy Enforced)

segment.source: When used elegantly, video interstitial ads can vastly increase your app revenue, without negatively impacting user satisfaction.
segment.target: When used elegantly, video interstitial ads can vastly increase your app revenue, without negatively impacting user satisfaction.

segment.source: When used improperly, such ads can have the exact opposite effect.
segment.target: When used improperly, such ads can have the exact opposite effect.

segment.source: Here we aim to help you achieve elegance.
segment.target: Here we aim to help you achieve elegance.

segment.source: Since you know your app better than anyone, except where policy is concerned, we leave it up to you to make the best final decision.
segment.target: Since you know your app better than anyone, except where policy is concerned, we leave it up to you to make the best final decision.

segment.source: What’s most important to keep in mind is that your app ratings and revenue are tightly coupled.
segment.target: What’s most important to keep in mind is that your app ratings and revenue are tightly coupled.

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: DO
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: DO

segment.source: Fit interstitial ads within the natural flow of the app, such as between game levels.
segment.target: Fit interstitial ads within the natural flow of the app, such as between game levels.

segment.source: Associate ads with tangible upsides, such as:
segment.target: Associate ads with tangible upsides, such as:

segment.source: Hints towards level completion.
segment.target: Hints towards level completion.

segment.source: Extra time to retry a level.
segment.target: Extra time to retry a level.

segment.source: Custom avatar features, like a tattoo or hat.
segment.target: Custom avatar features, like a tattoo or hat.

segment.source: If your app requires that a video ad be watched to completion, mention that rule upfront so they aren’t surprised with an error message upon hitting the close button.
segment.target: If your app requires that a video ad be watched to completion, mention that rule upfront so they aren’t surprised with an error message upon hitting the close button.

segment.source: Pre-fetch the ad (by calling RequestAd) ideally 30-60 seconds before you need to show it.
segment.target: Pre-fetch the ad (by calling RequestAd) ideally 30-60 seconds before you need to show it.

segment.source: Subscribe to all four events exposed in the InterstitialAd class (Canceled, Completed, AdReady, and ErrorOccurred) and use them to make the right decisions for your app.
segment.target: Subscribe to all four events exposed in the InterstitialAd class (Canceled, Completed, AdReady, and ErrorOccurred) and use them to make the right decisions for your app.

segment.source: Have some built-in experience to use in lieu of a server-matched ad.
segment.target: Have some built-in experience to use in lieu of a server-matched ad.

segment.source: You’ll find this useful in a few scenarios:
segment.target: You’ll find this useful in a few scenarios:

segment.source: Offline mode, when ad servers can’t be reached.
segment.target: Offline mode, when ad servers can’t be reached.

segment.source: When the ErrorOccurred event fires.
segment.target: When the ErrorOccurred event fires.

segment.source: If you opt to save user bandwidth based on ConnectionProfile, there are APIs in the ConnectionProfile class which can help.
segment.target: If you opt to save user bandwidth based on ConnectionProfile, there are APIs in the ConnectionProfile class which can help.

segment.source: Use the default (30s) timeout unless you have a valid reason to do otherwise, in which case don’t go below 10s.
segment.target: Use the default (30s) timeout unless you have a valid reason to do otherwise, in which case don’t go below 10s.

segment.source: Video ads take substantially longer to download than banners, especially in markets that don’t have high speed connections.
segment.target: Video ads take substantially longer to download than banners, especially in markets that don’t have high speed connections.

segment.source: Be mindful of the user’s data plan.
segment.target: Be mindful of the user’s data plan.

segment.source: For example, either don’t show, or warn user, before serving a video ad on a mobile device that is near/over its data limit.
segment.target: For example, either don’t show, or warn user, before serving a video ad on a mobile device that is near/over its data limit.

segment.source: There are APIs in the ConnectionProfile class which can help.
segment.target: There are APIs in the ConnectionProfile class which can help.

segment.source: Continuously improve your app after the initial submission.
segment.target: Continuously improve your app after the initial submission.

segment.source: Look at the ad reports and make design changes to improve fill and video completion rates.
segment.target: Look at the ad reports and make design changes to improve fill and video completion rates.

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: AVOID
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: AVOID

segment.source: Overdoing it.
segment.target: Overdoing it.

segment.source: Don’t force ads more than every 5 minutes or so, unless the user explicitly engages with an optional tangible benefit, beyond just playing the game.
segment.target: Don’t force ads more than every 5 minutes or so, unless the user explicitly engages with an optional tangible benefit, beyond just playing the game.

segment.source: Video interstitials at app launch, since users may believe they clicked the wrong tile.
segment.target: Video interstitials at app launch, since users may believe they clicked the wrong tile.

segment.source: Video interstitials at exit.
segment.target: Video interstitials at exit.

segment.source: This is bad inventory, since completion rates will be near zero.
segment.target: This is bad inventory, since completion rates will be near zero.

segment.source: Two or more video ads back to back.
segment.target: Two or more video ads back to back.

segment.source: Users will be frustrated to see the ad progress bar reset to the starting point.
segment.target: Users will be frustrated to see the ad progress bar reset to the starting point.

segment.source: Many will think it’s just a coding or ad serving bug.
segment.target: Many will think it’s just a coding or ad serving bug.

segment.source: Fetching a video ad more than 5 minutes before calling Show.
segment.target: Fetching a video ad more than 5 minutes before calling Show.

segment.source: Good inventory will maximize the conversion of pre-fetched ads to billable impressions.
segment.target: Good inventory will maximize the conversion of pre-fetched ads to billable impressions.

segment.source: Penalizing a user for failures in ad serving, such as no ad available.
segment.target: Penalizing a user for failures in ad serving, such as no ad available.

segment.source: For example, if you show a UI option to “Watch an ad to get xxx”, you should provide xxx if the user did her part.
segment.target: For example, if you show a UI option to “Watch an ad to get xxx”, you should provide xxx if the user did her part.

segment.source: Two options to consider:
segment.target: Two options to consider:

segment.source: Don’t include the option unless the AdReady event has fired.
segment.target: Don’t include the option unless the AdReady event has fired.

segment.source: Have the app include a built-in experience that yields the same benefit as a real ad.
segment.target: Have the app include a built-in experience that yields the same benefit as a real ad.

segment.source: Letting a user gain a competitive advantage in a multi-player game.
segment.target: Letting a user gain a competitive advantage in a multi-player game.

segment.source: A better gun in a first-person shooter game would clearly fall into this bucket.
segment.target: A better gun in a first-person shooter game would clearly fall into this bucket.

segment.source: A custom shirt on the player’s avatar is fine, so long as it doesn’t provide camouflage!
segment.target: A custom shirt on the player’s avatar is fine, so long as it doesn’t provide camouflage!

segment.source: Interstitial best practices: NEVER (Policy Enforced)
segment.target: Interstitial best practices: NEVER (Policy Enforced)

segment.source: Put any UI elements over the ad container.
segment.target: Put any UI elements over the ad container.

segment.source: Advertisers have paid for the full screen.
segment.target: Advertisers have paid for the full screen.

segment.source: Call Show while user is engaged with the app.
segment.target: Call Show while user is engaged with the app.

segment.source: Because the InterstitialAd will create a full screen overlay, the user will find this jarring.
segment.target: Because the InterstitialAd will create a full screen overlay, the user will find this jarring.

segment.source: It may also lead to exaggerated click-through rates.
segment.target: It may also lead to exaggerated click-through rates.

segment.source: Use ads to obtain anything that may be consumed as a currency or traded with other users.
segment.target: Use ads to obtain anything that may be consumed as a currency or traded with other users.
